summary: This is an email chain regarding the installation of new CCTV equipment at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, sent on August 11, 2019. It involves planning and coordination between SigNet Technologies personnel and MCC staff for upgrading the surveillance system.

persons.name: Steve Smith
persons.role: Federal Sales Representative at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions
persons.context: He is the sender of the original email and the forwarded update, providing the game plan for installing new CCTV equipment at MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeff Cranor
persons.context: He is listed as a recipient (Cc) in the email chain, likely involved in the CCTV equipment project at MCC New York.

persons.name: Jeffrey McKenzie
persons.context: He is mentioned as being from SigNet and will be on site at MCC New York on Monday to assist with the CCTV equipment installation.

persons.name: Justin
persons.context: He is mentioned as one of the Com Techs currently unboxing new hardware and setting up equipment in new racks for the CCTV system at MCC New York.

connections.description: Both are associated with SigNet Technologies and are coordinating on the CCTV equipment installation project at MCC New York.
Steve Smith includes Jeff Cranor as a recipient (Cc) in the email update regarding the CCTV equipment at MCC New York.
Both are involved in the technical setup of the new CCTV equipment at MCC New York, with Justin unboxing hardware and Jeffrey McKenzie scheduled to be on site.

events.title: CCTV Equipment Update for MCC New York
events.description: Steve Smith sends an email update outlining the game plan for installing new CCTV hardware at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, including tasks like unboxing equipment, setting up racks, and planning cutover from the old system.

events.title: Jeffrey McKenzie On-Site at MCC New York
events.description: Jeffrey McKenzie from SigNet Technologies is scheduled to be on site at MCC New York to assist with the CCTV equipment installation and will be sending NCIC forms.

locations: MCC New York (Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York)
Beltsville, MD 20705 (SigNet Technologies office at 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E)
keyFacts: The email discusses upgrading CCTV equipment at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, where Jeffrey Epstein was held.
The email is dated August 11, 2019, which is shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York on August 10, 2019.
The plan includes restoring recording to all channels as the first priority, indicating an emphasis on surveillance coverage.
SigNet Technologies, through representatives Steve Smith and Jeffrey McKenzie, is involved in the technical installation and coordination.
The email is part of a federal project, as indicated by Steve Smith's title as Federal Sales Representative for Convergint Federal Solutions.
